journey.title: Traversing the AI S-Curve
journey.description: Tracking my AI journey based on the Coatue AI S-Curve Framework

phasesOverview.name: Phase 1: AI Core Infrastructure
phasesOverview.description: Understanding the fundamental technologies powering AI development

phasesOverview.name: Phase 2: Edge AI
phasesOverview.description: Integrating AI capabilities into systems and devices at the edge

phasesOverview.name: Phase 3: AI Applications
phasesOverview.description: Building practical AI applications that solve business problems

phasesOverview.name: Phase 4+: Physical AI
phasesOverview.description: Exploring advanced AI applications in physical systems

foundationSkills.name: Business Foundation
foundationSkills.description: Core business skills that serve as a foundation for AI implementation

skills.name: Pattern Recognition
aiApplications: Identifying optimal use cases for AI implementation
Spotting patterns in business processes for automation

skills.name: Business Development
aiApplications: Positioning AI solutions for client needs
Building partnerships with AI technology providers
Developing go-to-market strategies for AI services

skills.name: Technical Skills
aiApplications: Analyzing data for AI training and testing
Integrating AI services with existing systems

skills.name: Team Collaboration

Communicating AI capabilities effectively to non-technical audiences

skills.name: Cloud Computing
skills.description: Setting up and managing cloud environments for AI applications
keyLearnings: Configuring cloud providers for AI workloads

skills.name: Data Management

keyLearnings: n8n workflow automation with AI integrations

skills.name: AI Customer Service

skills.name: Self-Driving Concepts

combinedCapabilities.name: AI Solution Consulting

applications: Creating AI implementation strategies for businesses
Evaluating and selecting appropriate AI tools

combinedCapabilities.name: Technical Solution Design

applications: Creating agent-based systems for business processes

combinedCapabilities.name: AI Implementation Leadership
combinedCapabilities.description: Guiding teams through AI transformation projects

combinedCapabilities.name: Context Engineering
combinedCapabilities.description: Architecting what AI knows before it reasons - designing the informational environment where understanding emerges
applications: System Prompts: CLAUDE.md files for persistent project memory
Tools & MCP: Extending AI capabilities with external integrations
Conversation Architecture: Designing information flow for optimal reasoning
Agentic workflows: Claude Code, automated quality gates
Voice-first AI: Real-time reasoning with voice synthesis
Cross-project patterns: Reusable context engineering templates

roadmap.description: Implement a system of autonomous agents that can perform market research and compile findings
Create a workshop framework to help businesses identify and implement AI opportunities
Develop a reusable framework for building industry-specific autonomous agents

casestudies.title: Jazz Scat - Voice AI Music Generator
casestudies.description: Voice AI that lets you sing and generates matching backing tracks in real-time. Built in 48 hours with no prior voice AI experienceâ€”2nd place at ElevenLabs Global Hackathon.
outcomes: 2nd place at ElevenLabs Global Hackathon (500+ participants)
First voice AI projectâ€”learned the entire stack during the hackathon
Proved that curiosity + AI tools beats years of specialized experience

casestudies.title: Nansen Voice - Conversational AI Foundation
casestudies.description: Voice-first AI assistant that remembers past conversations. Started as 'what if AI could have a real conversation?' and evolved into a reusable foundation for client projects.
outcomes: Built a working voice AI in one weekend
Learned mem0 memory system from scratch
Now reusing this pattern across 2 client projects

casestudies.title: Autonomous Research Team for Market Analysis
casestudies.description: Built a CrewAI-based system of agents that collaboratively performed market research and trend analysis
outcomes: Delivered comprehensive market reports in 1/3 of the time
Increased depth of analysis through systematic research patterns
Reduced costs of market intelligence gathering

casestudies.title: Marketing & Operations Automation - Ray of Joy Therapy
casestudies.description: Implementing comprehensive automation solutions for therapy practice management, marketing operations, and client engagement at rayofjoytherapy.com
outcomes: Streamlined client onboarding and scheduling processes
Automated marketing content distribution and engagement
Enhanced operational efficiency through integrated systems

casestudies.title: E-commerce Platform AI Enhancement
casestudies.description: Shopify customization with AI-powered features: gift wizard, tiered pricing automation, and MOQ management for Singapore B2B corporate gift company.

learningPaths.title: No-Code AI Branding
learningPaths.description: Build your professional presence with AI - no coding required
learningPaths.overview: This beginner-friendly path teaches you to leverage AI tools to create a professional online presence. Perfect for students, career changers, and anyone who wants to build their personal brand without learning to code.
objectives: Create a professional personal website using AI tools like v0.dev
Write compelling bios and content with AI assistance
Optimize your LinkedIn profile for AI-enhanced discovery
Develop a consistent personal brand across platforms
Understand the 'vibe coding' approach to building with AI

prerequisites: A desire to build your professional presence

phases.title: Week 1: AI Bio Writing
phases.description: Master the art of using AI to write compelling professional content about yourself.

modules.title: Understanding AI Writing Tools
topics: How to communicate effectively with AI
The difference between vague and specific prompts

modules.title: Crafting Your Professional Bio
topics: Adapting your bio for different contexts

modules.title: Week 1 Project
topics: Create 3 versions of your bio (short, medium, long)

phases.title: Week 2: Portfolio with v0.dev
phases.description: Build and deploy your personal website without writing any code.

modules.title: Introduction to v0.dev
topics: Creating your first page with natural language

phases.title: Week 3: LinkedIn Optimization
phases.description: Leverage AI to enhance your LinkedIn presence and professional network.

modules.title: AI-Enhanced Profile
topics: Using AI to write headline and summary

modules.title: Content Strategy
topics: Using AI to generate post ideas

modules.title: Networking with AI Support
topics: Preparing for interviews with AI practice

phases.title: Week 4: Your AI-Native Voice
phases.description: Integrate all skills into a cohesive personal brand strategy.

modules.title: Brand Consistency
topics: Aligning website, LinkedIn, and other platforms

modules.title: Advanced AI Collaboration
topics: Using AI for ongoing content creation
Building a prompt library for your brand
When to use which AI tool

process: Spend 2-3 hours per week on focused learning
Complete each week's project before moving on
Share your progress with a friend or mentor for feedback
Focus on authenticity - AI enhances your voice, doesn't replace it

learningPaths.title: LLM Handling Learning Path
learningPaths.description: A comprehensive roadmap for mastering large language models in practical applications
learningPaths.overview: This learning path focuses on developing the skills needed to effectively utilize large language models across various applications and workflows.
objectives: Effectively communicate with AI models through well-crafted prompts
Integrate AI capabilities into existing applications and workflows
Understand LLM limitations and implement appropriate guardrails
Design hybrid human-AI workflows that maximize the strengths of both
Evaluate and select the right models for specific use cases

phases.title: Phase 1: Fundamentals
phases.description: Build a solid foundation in understanding how LLMs work and how to interact with them effectively.

modules.title: Understanding LLMs
topics: Basic concepts: tokens, parameters, temperature, context window
Different model architectures and their strengths

phases.title: Phase 2: Integration & Application
phases.description: Learn how to incorporate LLMs into applications and existing workflows.

modules.title: API Integration
topics: Setting up API access to various models
Managing API costs and rate limits

modules.title: Suggested Projects
topics: Implement a simple data extraction system

phases.title: Phase 3: Advanced Techniques
phases.description: Master advanced techniques for optimizing LLM performance in complex scenarios.

modules.title: Model Fine-tuning
topics: When and why to fine-tune models

process: Complete at least one project in each phase before moving on
Join communities like Hugging Face and AI Discord servers to share experiences

learningPaths.title: Agent & RAG Learning Path
learningPaths.description: Build intelligent agents and implement Retrieval Augmented Generation for more capable AI systems
learningPaths.overview: This advanced learning path focuses on building autonomous agents and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) systems for sophisticated AI applications.
objectives: Build AI agents that can perform complex, multi-step tasks
Implement effective RAG systems for knowledge-intensive applications
Design and deploy multi-agent systems for collaborative tasks
Integrate external tools and APIs with agents
Create memory and knowledge retrieval systems for AI applications

prerequisites: Solid understanding of LLM capabilities and limitations
Programming proficiency in Python or JavaScript

phases.title: Phase 1: Agent Fundamentals
phases.description: Understand the core concepts of AI agents and their implementation.

modules.title: Agent Architecture
topics: Core components of an AI agent

phases.title: Phase 2: Retrieval Augmented Generation
phases.description: Master the techniques for augmenting LLMs with external knowledge.

modules.title: Vector Databases
topics: Setting up Pinecone, Weaviate, or Chroma

phases.title: Phase 3: Advanced Agent Systems
phases.description: Build sophisticated multi-agent systems with memory and advanced capabilities.

modules.title: Capstone Project
topics: Design a complex agent system with RAG capabilities

process: Build increasingly complex projects as you progress
Focus on a specific domain application (e.g., customer service, research assistant)
Continuously evaluate and refine your implementations

learningPaths.title: Three-Hat Technical Leadership Framework
learningPaths.description: Master the integration of systems architecture, product management, and hands-on implementation for comprehensive AI solutions
learningPaths.overview: This advanced learning path teaches you to seamlessly switch between three critical perspectives: Systems Architect (big picture), Product Manager (value optimization), and Implementation (delivery excellence). Based on hard-won insights from real-world AI projects.
objectives: Develop systems thinking to prevent technical debt and complexity explosion
Master data-driven product management for AI features
Build robust implementation practices with quality gates and monitoring
Learn to context-switch effectively between the three hats
Apply the framework to deliver fractional CTO-level value

prerequisites: Experience building and deploying AI applications
Some exposure to product management concepts
Willingness to learn from failures and iterate

phases.title: Phase 1: The Systems Architect Hat
phases.description: Learn to think in systems, architectures, and scalable designs that prevent future problems.

modules.title: Foundation First Thinking
topics: The Pareto principle in architecture (80/20 rule)
Identifying the core 20% that delivers 80% value
Building modular, extensible systems from the start

modules.title: Scalability & Complexity Management
topics: Monitoring complexity before it explodes (69â†’10 tools lesson)
Chaos engineering principles for AI systems

modules.title: Technical Debt Prevention
topics: Early warning signs of architectural problems
Protocol compliance as business risk (the $50K stdout lesson)

phases.title: Phase 2: The Product Manager Hat
phases.description: Optimize for user value, business impact, and data-driven decision making.

modules.title: User Journey Optimization
topics: Building user feedback loops into AI systems

modules.title: Data-Driven AI Features
topics: Usage analytics that drive architecture decisions
Feature lifecycle: Discovery â†’ Experimentation â†’ Optimization

modules.title: Business Impact Alignment
topics: Translating technical capabilities to business outcomes

phases.title: Phase 3: The Implementation Hat
phases.description: Excellence in delivery through quality gates, automation, and continuous improvement.

modules.title: Quality Gates & Testing
topics: Monitoring beyond uptime - the metrics that matter

modules.title: Developer Experience
topics: Hot reload and rapid iteration for AI development

modules.title: Continuous Improvement
topics: Weekly metrics â†’ monthly architecture reviews
Building improvement culture in AI teams

phases.title: Phase 4: Framework Integration
phases.description: Apply all three hats together for comprehensive technical leadership.

process: Start with self-assessment: Which hat do you naturally wear most?
Focus on strengthening your weakest hat first
Apply the framework to a real project throughout the learning process
Document your 'hard lessons learned' as you go
Share insights with the community to reinforce learning

sections.quote: Applying the Fitzgerald Principle to AI: holding the opposing ideas of human irreplaceability AND AI capabilities simultaneously.

sections.title: Why Human-AI Collaboration
sections.description: Understanding the AI S-Curve: We're at the inflection point where AI transitions from novelty to necessity. The question isn't whether to collaborate with AI, but how to do it in ways that amplify rather than diminish human agency.

sections.title: Context Engineering
sections.description: The real skill isn't promptingâ€”it's architecting what AI knows before it reasons. Three pillars: System Prompts (persistent memory), Tools & MCP (extended capabilities), and Conversation Architecture (information flow).

sections.title: The Fitzgerald Principle
sections.description: Most people use AI to do more. I'm exploring how to do lessâ€”systematically. AI as complementarity, not replacement. Time compounds faster than money.

sections.title: Three-Hat Framework
sections.description: Rapid context switching validated across 3+ client projects

items.title: Product Manager
items.description: User needs, feature prioritization, business value

sections.title: Claude Mastery Program
sections.description: 8 comprehensive modules covering everything from prompt engineering to computer use capabilities. Includes 2025 breakthroughs: Claude Opus 4.5, Claude Code, Extended Thinking, and Prompt Caching.

sections.title: Portfolio Highlights
sections.description: Real implementations proving human-AI collaboration creates value greater than the sum of parts

items.title: Jazz Scat
items.description: 2nd place ElevenLabs Hackathon - Voice AI music generator

items.title: Nansen Voice
items.description: Voice-first conversational AI with persistent memory

experiments.title: ADHD-AI Optimization
experiments.description: Hypothesis: ADHD cognitive patterns provide natural advantages for AI collaboration speed and context switching.

experiments.title: 2-Minute Rule for AI
experiments.description: If users can't achieve first success within 2 minutes, the AI architecture has failed.

sections.title: Living Laboratory
sections.description: Every framework is tested in real implementations. Proof over promises, experiments over theories. Exploring the convergence of AI, Sustainability, and Robotics.
